Detailed Description

This file contains methods that could be used when changing things on one map.

They are located here (and not in e.g. OldGenericMap or GMSMap) to make sure that they could be used by other programs, e.g. MapEditor. This also means that You should know what You are doing when/if You change or add things to this class!

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum OldExtraDataUtility::record_t
 

Enumeration values:
COMMENT  This is not a real record -- only a comment!
ADD_CITYPART  Add cityparts, with lon lat and one to many names to a map.
UPDATE_NAME  Update the name of an item.
SET_RAMP  Set the ramp-attribute of the given street-segment item to a new value (bool).
SET_ROUNDABOUT  Set the roundabout-attribute of the given street-segment item to a new value (bool).
SET_MULTIDIGITISED  Set the mulit-dig.-attribute of the given street-segment item to a new value (bool).
SET_ENTRYRESTRICTIONS  Set the entryrestrictions of the given node item to a new value (ItemTypes::entryrestriction_t).
SET_SPEEDLIMIT  Set the speedlimit of the given node item to a new value (int).
SET_LEVEL  Set the level of the given node item to a new value (int).
SET_TURNDIRECTION  Set the turndirection of the given connection to a new value (ItemTypes::turndirection_t).
SET_HOUSENUMBER  Set the the housenumber of an OldStreetSegmentItem.

Left/right, start/end and the type as an integer.

ADD_NAME_TO_ITEM  Add one name to an item.
SET_VEHICLERESTRICTIONS  Set the vehicle restrictions of the given connection to a new value.
ADD_LANDMARK  Add a landmark to the map, calculate the landmark description and store in the landmark table.
ADD_SINGLE_LANDMARK  Add a single landmark to the map (only to one connection), and store the description in the landmark table.
REMOVE_NAME_FROM_ITEM  Remove one name of an item.
REMOVE_ITEM  Remove one item from the map.

If the item is used as a landmark, also those records in the landmark table are removed from the map.

ADD_SIGNPOST  Add a signpost to a connection.
REMOVE_SIGNPOST  Remove a signpost from a connection.
SET_ROUNDABOUTISH  Set the roundaboutish-attribute of the given street-segment item to a new value (bool).
SET_CONTROLLEDACCESS  Set the controlled access-attribute of the given street-segment item to a new value (bool).
SET_WATER_TYPE  Set the water type of a water item to a specific value.
SET_TOLLROAD  Set the road toll attribute of the given node to a new value (bool).
NUMBER_OF_RECORD_TYPES  The number of record-types.

Definition at line 47 of file OldExtraDataUtility.h.

enum OldExtraDataUtility::selectConn_t
 

Describes what connections to choose when adding landmarks to the landmark table in the map.

The landmark is tied to either all connections, connections with a turndescription that says ahead or followroad, or connections with a description that is not ahead or followroad (turn).

The connections selection is dependent on where the coordinate for finding close street segments is located.

If the ssi coordinate is in a crossing, the selection will contain those connections that lead to any node(s) in the crossing. If the ssi coordinate is on one street segment, the selection will contain those connections that lead to the crossings in both nodes of the segment, and comes from the other node of that segment, i.e. connections OVER the segment.

Enumeration values:
ALLCONN  The landmark will be tied to any connections in the crossing(s).
AHEADCONN  The landmark will be tied to ahead|followroad connections.
TURNCONN  The landmark will be tied to "turn"-connections.
NOCONN  Tie to no connection.

The location is set to pass, regardless of the turndescription for the connection(s). These three selection alternatives will not be so good to use if the ssi coordinate is located in a crossing, but work very fine is the ssi coordinate is on a segment.

int OldExtraDataUtility::addLandmark (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
ItemTypes::itemType  it,
ItemTypes::pointOfInterest_t  pt,
uint32  importance,
int32  lat,
int32  lon,
uint32  radius,
int32  itemlat,
int32  itemlon,
const char *  itemName,
selectConn_t  selConns
)  [static]
 

Adds a landmark to the landmark table of a map.

Parameters:
theMap The map in which to add the landmark.
it Type of the item representing the landmark. param pt If a poi, the pointOfInterest type.
importance Importance of the landmark, 0-4.
lat/lon Coordinate for finding close street segment(s), to which this landmarks should be added.
radius Search for ssi within radius meters.
itemlat Latitude coordinate of the item representing the landmark.
itemlon Longitude coordinate of the item representing the landmark.
itemName Name of the item representing the landmark.
selConns Gives what connections the landmark should be tied to, see selectConn_t.
Returns:
The number of connections the landmark is tied to.

int OldExtraDataUtility::addNameToItem (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
OldItem *  item,
ItemTypes::itemType  it,
MC2String  nname,
ItemTypes::name_t  nt,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
vector< uint32 > &  affectsStreets
)  [static]
 

Add a name to an item either when the name is missing or when the item should have more than one name.

This is the method called from ExtraDataReader and MapEditor.

Parameters:
theMap The map where the item is located.
item The selected item.
it The type of the item.
nname The new name that should be given the item.
nt The name type of the new name.
lang The language type of the new name.
affectsStreets Vector where to store ids of items that affects streets (ssi + si). Used when applying extra data to merged maps.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::addSingleLandmark (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
OldItem *  lmItem,
uint32  importance,
int  location,
int  side,
OldNode *  fromNode,
OldNode *  toNode
)  [static]
 

Add a single landmark to the landmark table of a map.

The landmark record is tied to the connection from fromNode to toNode.

Parameters:
theMap The map in which to add the landmark.
lmItem The item representing the landmark.
importance Importance of the landmark, 0-4.
location The landmark location in relation to the conection.
side The landmark side in relation to the connection.
fromNode The fromNode of the connection.
toNode The toNode of the connection.
Returns:
True if the landmark is added to the landmark table of the map, false otherwise.

MC2String OldExtraDataUtility::createEDFileString (  vector< MC2String > &  subStrings,
bool  addEndOfRec = false
)  [static]
 

Create a string from sub strings in a vector.

The string created will be in extra data style, i.e. use this method to create strings to write in extra data files. It uses the edFieldSep as separator. Separator will be written after the last substring. It is possible to add the EndOfRecord tag (with separator) after the last sub string.

Parameters:
subStrings Sub strings to merge into one string.
addEndOfRec If true add the EndOfRecord-tag last, if false (default) don't add.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::crossingTlike (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
Vector &  ssiIDs
)  [static, private]
 

Finds out if the crossing consisting of some street segments can be considered to look like a T-crossing.

Here T-crossing is defined by that one/many pair of connections (a connection and its reverse) in the crossing have turndescription AHEAD or FOLLOWROAD.

Parameters:
theMap The maps that the crossing is located in.
ssiIDs Vector with the itemIDs of the street segments that are in the crossing.

void OldExtraDataUtility::getAllItemsWithName (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
const   uint32,
Vector *  result

bool OldExtraDataUtility::getLandmarkLocationAndSide (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
OldConnection *  conn,
uint32  toNodeID,
int32  itemlat,
int32  itemlon,
uint32  itemID,
ItemTypes::landmark_t  lmType,
Vector &  ssiIDs,
ItemTypes::landmarklocation_t &  location,
SearchTypes::side_t &  side
)  [static, private]
 

Calculates location and side for the landmark (lm) description.

Parameters:
theMap The map where the landmark is located.
conn The connection, to which the landmark should be tied.
toNodeID Which node conn leads to.
itemlat Latitude of the item representing the lm.
itemlon Longitude of the item representing the lmk.
itemID The iD of the item representing the landmark.
lmType The type of the landmark.
ssiIDs Vector with the ssiIDs that is in the crossing, to which the landmark is tied to.
location Outparam landmark location.
side Outparam landmark side.
Returns:
True, if the outparameters are set alright. False if the params are not set alright, e.g. if the crossing was not a 2, 3 or 4-ways crossing. Then the landmark should not be added.

byte OldExtraDataUtility::getNameOffsetForItem (  OldItem *  item,
uint32  enameIndex,
ItemTypes::name_t  nt,
LangTypes::language_t  lang
)  [static]
 

Get the offset in one item for one name with specified string index, name type and language.

Parameters:
item The item to check.
enameIndex The index of the string to look for.
nt The name-type to look for. If maxDefinedName is given the name type will not be looked upon when searching for the name offset. This will give as a result the item's first matching name, though.
lang The language to look for.
Returns:
The offset of the name with given stringindex, type and language. MAX_BYTE is returned upon error.

OldNode* OldExtraDataUtility::getNodeFromStrings (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
CoordinateTransformer::format_t  coordType,
const MC2String &  coord1,
const MC2String &  coord2
)  [static]
 

Find a node from two coordinates.

Parameters:
theMap The map where to look for a node.
coordType The type of the coordinates in the strings.
coord1 A string with the first coordinate.
coord2 A string with the second coordinate.
Returns:
The node that was found, false otherwise.

record_t OldExtraDataUtility::getRecordType (  MC2String &  s  )  [static]
 

Get the record type (record_t) from a string.

Parameters:
s A string with the name of the record.
Returns:
The record_t describes by s. NUMBER_OF_RECORD_TYPES will be returned if no matching record is found.

selectConn_t OldExtraDataUtility::getSelectConns (  MC2String &  s  )  [static]
 

Find out what connections (selectConn_t) to tie landmarks to.

Parameters:
s A string with the name of the connections selection.
Returns:
The selectConn_t described by s. NO_CONN will be returned if no matching record is found.

SearchTypes::side_t OldExtraDataUtility::getSide (  OldStreetSegmentItem *  ssi,
uint32  nodeNbr,
int32  itemlat,
int32  itemlon,
bool  fromSide = true,
bool  within = true
)  [static, private]
 

Get side for the landmark description.

Calculates on which side of the street segment with direction from node nodeNbr the landmark represented by a point (itemlat,itemlon) is located.

Parameters:
ssi The street segment.
nodeNbr From what node (0 or 1) on the ssi.
itemlat The lat coordinate of the point (the lm).
itemlon The lon coordinate of the point (the lm).
fromSide True if ssi is the segment you use to get TO the crossing and false if ssi is the segment that leads FROM the crossing. To and from are related to the connection, to which this landmark description is tied.
within If the landmarkitem coordinate is "within" the ssi. From the withinSsi-method.
Returns:
The side, valid values are right_side, left_side, unknown_side or side_does_not_matter. Unknown is returned if the point is located just in front of or right behind the ssi. Side_does_not_matter is returned if the crossing is located IN the landmark (e.g. a park).

bool OldExtraDataUtility::hasItemName (  OldItem *  item,
const uint32  rawStringIndex
)  [static, private]
 

Find out if an item has a given name with nameType and language.

Parameters:
item The item to check.
rawStringIndex String-index of the name, including name_t and language_t.
Returns:
True if the item has the name+name_t+language_t, false otherwise.

void OldExtraDataUtility::init (   )  [static, private]
 

Initiate the dictionaries used in this class.

Uses the static member m_initiated to make sure the class only is initiated once.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::nextToken (  MC2String &  src,
MC2String &  token
)  [static, private]
 

Scan for next token in a extra data record string.

The tokens separated by the edFieldSep string.

Parameters:
src Source string to scan for next token.
token Outparam, the token.
Returns:
True upon success = there was another token to read from source string, false otherwise = no token.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::onSsi (  OldStreetSegmentItem *  ssi,
int32  itemlat,
int32  itemlon
)  [static, private]
 

Checks if a point is located on a street segment.

Checks every pair of coordinates of the segment and if the distance from the point to any of the sub-segment is 0, the point is considered to be located on the segment.

Returns:
True if the point is on the segment, false otherwise.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::readNextRecordFromFile (  istream &  is,
vector< MC2String > &  recordAsStrings
)  [static]
 

Read a complete record and store it as strings in vector.

The end-tag "EndOfRecord" is not added to the vector.

Parameters:
is The stream to read the record from.
recordAsStrings Outparameter where the record will be stored.
Returns:
True.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::removeItem (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
OldItem *  item
)  [static]
 

Removes an item from the map.

If the item is used as a landmark, also the landmark records in the landmark table of the map are removed.

Parameters:
theMap The map from which to remove the item.
item The item to remove.

int OldExtraDataUtility::removeNameFromItem (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
OldItem *  item,
ItemTypes::itemType  it,
MC2String &  ename,
ItemTypes::name_t  nt,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
vector< uint32 > &  affectsStreets
)  [static]
 

Removes a name of an item.

Parameters:
theMap The map containing the name.
item The selected item.
it The itemtype of the items that has this name.
ename The name to remove.
nt The name type of the name.
lang The language type of the name.
affectsStreets Vector where to store ids of items that affects streets (ssi + si). Used when applying extra data to merged maps.
Returns:
The number of items that had their names removed. (-1) upon error.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::strtolatlon (  const MC2String &  s,
int32 &  lat,
int32 &  lon,
CoordinateTransformer::format_t  coordType
)  [static]
 

Get the numeric value of a coordinate in the location token '(' <lat> ',' <lon> ')'.

Parameters:
s The string token to convert.
lat Latitude value.
lon Longitude value.
coordType The type of the coordinate to transform.
Returns:
True upon success, false otherwise.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::transferChangeToVirtualNode (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
uint32  nodeID,
int  val,
record_t  edType,
vector< uint32 > &  changedVirtuals
)  [static]
 

If a node changed by an extra data record is connected to a virtual routeable item, the change is in this method applied also to the virtual's node.

Parameters:
theMap The map in which the node is located
nodeID The id of the node that was changed by extra data.
val The new value.
edType The kind of extra data correction.
changedVirtuals Outparam that is filled with node ids of any virtual nodes that are changed.
Returns:
True if any connected virtual nodes were found and changed, false if not.

int OldExtraDataUtility::updateName (  OldGenericMap *  theMap,
OldItem *  item,
ItemTypes::itemType  it,
MC2String  ename,
ItemTypes::name_t  nt,
LangTypes::language_t  lang,
MC2String  nname,
vector< uint32 > &  affectsStreets
)  [static]
 

Updates a misspelled or faulty name.

This is the method called from ExtraDataReader and MapEditor.

Parameters:
theMap The map containing the name.
item The selected item.
it The itemtype of the items that has this name.
ename The existing name (misspelled).
nt The name type of the name.
lang The language type of the name.
nname The new name (correctly spelled).
affectsStreets Vector where to store ids of items that affects streets (ssi + si). Used when applying extra data to merged maps.
Returns:
The number of items that had their names updated. (-1) upon error.

bool OldExtraDataUtility::withinSsi (  OldStreetSegmentItem *  ssi,
int32  itemlat,
int32  itemlon,
int32  crossinglat,
int32  crossinglon
)  [static, private]
 

Finds out if a landmark represented by a point (itemlat,itemlon) is located "within" the ssi or not.

Within = if the closest coordinate to the point on ssi is not in the crossingnode of the ssi.

Returns:
True if the point is within the ssi, false if it isn't.
